title: Node introducer adds duplicate nodes

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Did some testing with the node introduce feature. One of my nodes it added duplicate nodes. It probably doesn't matter functionally but it looks weird and messes with node lists

Ayano and NBSIGB is the same node. Note: I can't edit the one named NBSIG. But if i delete ayano both disappear. 

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/153440/4425391/6a88c7de-45a9-11e4-93f0-7491967fe449.PNG)

Part of the config, Here you can se that it added NBSIGBU even though it was already configured. 

``` xml
<node id="NBSIGBU-...." name="ayano" compression="true" introducer="true">   
   <address>dynamic</address>                                                                                                  
</node>                                                                                                                         
<node id="SHYPNFF-...." name="freenas2" compression="false" introducer="false
">                                                                                                                                  
   <address>dynamic</address>                                                                                                  
</node>                                                                                                                         
<node id="7DCLG2A-...." name="origo" compression="false" introducer="true">  
   <address>dynamic</address>                                                                                                  
</node>                                                                                                                         
<node id="NBSIGBU-..." compression="false" introducer="false"></node>                                            
```
